newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: CS recommends overweighting Georg Fischer.
newsitem.headline: CS recommends overweighting Georg Fischer.

text.p: CS Research said it was recommending overweighting Swiss engineering group Georg Fischer AG in a model portfolio, but also said it was lowering its earnings estimates.

"In the second half of the current year operating performance should improve significantly, but it will be difficult to make up for the disappointing performance in the first half," CS Research said in a recent study.
Georg Fischer reported on August 29 that its group net in the first half fell to 20 million Swiss francs from 35 million in the comparable 1995 period.
CS Research analyst Andrea Snider said CS had reduced its earnings per share estimates for 1996 and 1997 by about 20 percent to 90 Swiss francs, and 115 Swiss francs, respectively.
But CS Research noted that Georg Fischer's manufacturing technology division, including Charmilles, and piping systems divisions continued to be "on a profitable growth path."
It added that interim results reflected start-up costs and "inefficient management of changes" in manufacturing processes at the concern's automotive products group.
Georg Fischer said in July it was acquiring a majority stake in Swiss electro-erosion machinery maker AGIE Holding AG.
The company plans to consolidate its Charmilles Technologies unit with AGIE. The merger is expected to receive the approval of U.S. anti-trust authorities in the next few weeks, CS Research said.
CS Research also said that Fischer had an attractive portfolio of assets, with potential to earn excess returns. -- Zurich Editorial, +41 1 631 7340
